glsa.title: Clam AntiVirus: Multiple vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: Multiple vulnerabilities were found in Clam AntiVirus, the most severe of which may allow the execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: Clam AntiVirus (short: ClamAV) is an anti-virus toolkit for UNIX, designed especially for e-mail scanning on mail gateways.

description.p: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Clam AntiVirus. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.

impact.p: An unauthenticated remote attacker may execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the Clam AntiVirus process or cause a Denial of Service by causing an affected user or system to scan a crafted file.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
